title: Chocolate-Orange Cupcakes with Pistachio Buttercream Recipe
description: From-scratch chocolate and orange-flavored cupcakes are topped with pistachio buttercream icing.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Ingredients Nuts and Seed Recipes Pistachio Recipes Chocolate-Orange Cupcakes with Pistachio Buttercream 4.7 (7) 5 Reviews 4 Photos Easy, fool-proof cupcakes inspired by the colors of Halloween. I wrote this recipe for a food-writing class! The olive oil in the batter makes them moist, and instant pudding mix gives the buttercream a hint of pistachio. Submitted by Pietime Published on June 18, 2020 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 dozen cupcakes Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 teaspoon shortening, or as needed 1 teaspoon all-purpose flour, or as needed Cake: 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour, sifted 1 cup white sugar 3 tablespoons cocoa powder 1 teaspoon baking soda ¼ teaspoon salt 1 cup cold water ⅓ cup olive oil 2 tablespoons orange juice ½ teaspoon vanilla extract 1 tablespoon grated orange zest Icing: ½ cup unsalted butter ⅔ cup confectioners' sugar, sifted 2 tablespoons instant pistachio pudding mix 2 tablespoons cold water 1 ounce dark chocolate, grated Directions Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups with shortening using a paper towel and dust with about 1 teaspoon flour or line with paper liners. Combine 1 1/2 cups flour, white sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer. Beat 1 cup cold water, olive oil, orange juice, and vanilla extract into flour mixture on medium-low speed until batter is just combined, about 2 minutes. Fold orange zest into batter. Pour batter into prepared muffin cups, 2/3-full. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into a cupcake comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Transfer cupcakes to a wire rack to cool completely, about 30 minutes. Beat butter in a bowl using an electric mixer in medium speed until fluffy, about 1 minute. Slowly pour confectioners' sugar into creamed butter and beat until incorporated, about 2 minutes. Beat pudding mix into butter mixture until just combined. Add water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency of icing is reached. Ice the cooled cupcakes; garnish with grated chocolate. Add Your Photo Photos of Chocolate-Orange Cupcakes with Pistachio Buttercream 01 of 04 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 04 Photo by  Ghost 07/09/2019 So delicious! I substituted the 1/3 cup of oil for melted butter, I do in all my baking. I also had to double the frosting recipe. 03 of 04 Photo by  Jess Nemcov 02/23/2017 1 You’ll Also Love Carrot Cupcakes with White Chocolate Cream Cheese Icing 561 Ratings Chocolate Cupcakes with Caramel Frosting 85 Ratings Strawberry-Chocolate Mini Cupcakes with White Chocolate Ganache 6 Ratings Halloween Chocolate Cupcakes with Monster Peanut Butter Eyes Raspberry White Chocolate Buttercream Cupcakes 46 Ratings Monster Chocolate Cupcakes for Halloween Brownie Cupcakes with Hazelnut Buttercream 15 Ratings Peppermint Cupcakes with Marshmallow Fluff White Chocolate Frosting 6 Ratings White Chocolate-Orange-Pistachio Thumbprint Cookies 3 Ratings Halloween Fondant Ghost Cupcakes 3 Ratings Chocolate Cupcakes with Cream Cheese-Oreo-Buttercream Frosting 8 Ratings Pumpkin-Chocolate Layer Cake 5 Ratings Monster Mini Cupcakes Spider Cupcakes 91 Ratings Worm Cake 26 Ratings Best Chocolate Ganache Cake 5 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Pietime
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups with shortening using a paper towel and dust with about 1 teaspoon flour or line with paper liners.;Combine 1 1/2 cups flour, white sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer. Beat 1 cup cold water, olive oil, orange juice, and vanilla extract into flour mixture on medium-low speed until batter is just combined, about 2 minutes. Fold orange zest into batter. Pour batter into prepared muffin cups, 2/3-full.;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into a cupcake comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Transfer cupcakes to a wire rack to cool completely, about 30 minutes.;Beat butter in a bowl using an electric mixer in medium speed until fluffy, about 1 minute. Slowly pour confectioners' sugar into creamed butter and beat until incorporated, about 2 minutes. Beat pudding mix into butter mixture until just combined. Add water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency of icing is reached. Ice the cooled cupcakes; garnish with grated chocolate.
